alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:32AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hennepin, northwestern Dakota, southern Washington and Ramsey Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1031 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over MSP International Airport where a gust of 45 mph was observed at 1031 AM, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rosemount around 1035 AM CDT. Mendota Heights around 1040 AM CDT. Inver Grove Heights, South St. Paul and West St. Paul around 1045 AM CDT. St. Paul, Cottage Grove and St. Paul Park around 1050 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Woodbury and Afton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
